name: BEST WESTERN Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo

reviews.title: Shelter in the Storm....
reviews.text: We stayed at this property for two nights culminating a 15 day trip to Italy. Arriving abut 11:30PM after a miserable 12 hours on a train with multiple delays etc, we struggled with our luggage to find a water bus taxi to the deserted St. Marcos (Mark's) Square arriving in a torrential downpour. Consequently by the time we found our way to the hotel, we were exhausted, wet, starved and somewhat apprehensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel exceeded our expectations from the beginning of our stay to the end especially after having heard about some of the problems with hotels in Venice. Other than the high rates (euro exchange & general cost of Venice) we cannot complain.
reviews.title: Good location but...

reviews.text: We found the room small but cmfortable & adequate... and quickly raided the snack basket and stocked bar while changing into dry clothes to search for a restaurant. We soon discovered a fact about Venice in that hardly any locals live there (cannot afford it and commute to the mainland) and hence few service providing places stay open late. The hotel restaurant WAS closed but the barman took pity on us and raided the closed kitchen serving us a wonderful lasagna meal even though he was very busy.
reviews.title: Good location, awful bathroom, so-so service

likes.disliked: — Mold, cracked tiles, chipped mirror in bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is fantastic....exit the door , cross a small foot-bridge and you are actually IN St. Mark's Square. And only about 2 blocks from the Grande Canal and public transportation. Gondola rides are available at the side of the hotel and the motorized water taxi we ordered to take us to the airport actually picked us off the hotel balcony.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Fantastic Location

likes.disliked: — The double room size for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast buffet was excellent with many choices of breads & pastry, meats, eggs, various fruit, juices etc. Most staff members spoke English fluently with a strong service orientation.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of stars, took cheaper option of room not overlooking basin as you only sleep and shower in room which was slightly tired but real venetian.Lovely.
reviews.title: Very close to St Marks sq

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To get the best veiw of the basin and gondolas which is packed with tourists during the day just sit at you breakfast table where it all starts about 10am.
reviews.title: Great Value at the Hotel Cavalletto E Doge Orseolo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Area very quiet at night.
reviews.title: What a nice surprise

reviews.text: Hotels externally recommended restaurant always seemed to be closed but plenty of others nearby up the ally to tha end and turn right.Avoid the self service one to the left as done with microwaves and horrible plus miserable staff.
reviews.title: Very Nice Accomodations

likes.liked: — Good central location to all the sights of Venice
likes.disliked: — The logistics of getting our luggage there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally Avoid weekends as better value and less crowded
reviews.title: Tiny room, but massively charming

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights as a family group of 4 in 2 rooms.
reviews.title: Treat Yourself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were in the new building across the passageway from reception and were a good size, with generously-sized bathrooms. We had de-luxe rooms which were well-furnished in typical traditional style, with good air-conditioning. Our double had a large bed and a sofa. Views only of rooftops but very quiet at all times.
reviews.title: Above Average Hotel but could improve in some areas

reviews.text: The special features of this hotel are: 1) the location just off St Mark's. An earlier reviewer gave most helpful directions to find the hotel - head for the corner on the clock side of Piazza San Marco but at the opposite end to St Mark's, look for the telephone kiosks and walk through past them and you will cross a small bridge and be at reception almost immediately. 2) the location on the canal basin means drinks can be had on a balcony overlooking the gondolas. Watch romantic couples set off with champagne and song for free or do it yourself from the hotel's own mooring. Breakfast also provides free entertainment as the gondoliers start their day.
reviews.title: Part Of a honeymon 2night stop over in Venice

reviews.text: Venice is expensive and this hotel is not cheap but if you feel like treating yourself to an experience which will live in the memory, enjoy a glass of chilled Prosecco on the balcony in the evening and soak up the unique and magical atmosphere. Then stroll into Piazza San Marco to see the wonderful architecture by moonlight and hear the cafe bands - brilliant.
reviews.title: In the middle of the action

likes.disliked: — All of the stairs and confusing hallways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would say that most people would give the Hotel Cavalletto an Average rating. There are a few things that made us want to give it an ABOVE AVERAGE rating.
reviews.title: Location, location, location - you get what you pay for???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picked this hotel on the basis of its star rating and location but was starting to regret it after the first night. The room was clean and well presented and there were two windows out onto the canal and a street that divided the two parts of the hotel, the room was on the
reviews.title: Great location if you don't like sleeping!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: second floor. As it was hot it was necessary to have the bedroom windows wide open as the air conditioning is not switched on until June!, well Saturday night in St Marks Square is noisy, very noisy. But the option was boil alive or try and sleep through it. Second night a party from Mobil/Exxon were booked in for a party in Venice, well they liked to party until 1am in the bar below our room and apparantly there a number of [-----] employed in the company or so they kept bragging and shouting. I mentioned in the morning to staff about keeping the bar windows shut to keep the noise down but I got the impression that corporate customers are more important than tourists. In the main the staff were courteous with the exception of some of the reception staff who seemed somewhat superior to all. Breakfast in the main was excellent except for the final morning when
reviews.title: Fantastic location
Not my favorite hotel
reviews.text: a large party seemed to have cleared everything out and the staff could not cope and there was a struggle to find anything to eat within 45 minutes of breakfast starting. If you do go, do not take a room overlooking the street as the sound of the door slamming shut into the hotel will drive you to distraction, do not go outside of June to September or else you will be without air conditioning and it is necessary. There is a brilliant balcony area overlooking the gondolier station although you may struggle to get the staff to actually open it up and struggle to get someone to deliver a drink to you once there. I would not stay there again although I will return to Venice as it is a wonderful city.

reviews.title: No More Than 2 Star For A Poor Service
reviews.text: We have just come back from the 'Albergo Cavalletto' and I have to say it was one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The location is fantastic, so easy to get to once you arrive at St Marks - just look out for the telephone kiosks at the far end of St Marks. The staff were very helpful and freindly. If, like us, you enjoy a cup of tea after a hard days walking, don't forget to ask for a kettle to be sent up to your room. Our room overlooked the basin and although the gondoliers arrived quite early outside, you can't hear them as long as your windows are shut! We were willing to pay the extra for this hotel because we were celebrating a special occasion and it was definitely worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Cavaletto in Venice for 2 nights. The hotel is quite attractive but the staff is not very friendly. Our room was 4' by 7' and the beds were 29 inches wide and very short. There are four rooms of this size so, if you intend to stay there, be sure you have one of the larger rooms.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

aka: Best Western Cavalletto e Doge Orseolo Hotel Venice
